abstract.text: Initializes a vImage buffer with a copy of the contents of a Core Video pixel buffer.

structure. On return, the function allocates new memory to the buffer and sets the buffer’s size to match the
instance’s dimensions.

structure that specifies the image format of the

, the function uses
The source
instance. It’s not necessary to lock the pixel buffer before calling this function.
An optional
instance that specifies the pixel format of the source pixel buffer. If this parameter is
, the function attempts to derive this information from the Core Video pixel buffer.
If the source image contains alpha information and the destination format doesn’t contain alpha information, this function flattens the source image against this parameter.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass

Some Core Video pixel buffers and image formats have incompletely specified color information that prevents
from performing the conversion. In this situation, the function returns one of the format errors below. To proceed, create a
instance, add the missing information, and pass the image format instance as the
parameter to this function. It’s possible that more than one piece of information is missing.
The conversion matrix is missing from the
or the
. Use the
function to copy a conversion matrix to an image format.
The chrominance siting information is missing from the
or the
. Use
to set the chrominance siting on an image format.
The color space that contains primaries and transfer function is missing from the
or the
. Use
to set the color space on an image format.
For compatibility with Core Video, vImage substitutes gamma
for
and substitutes the ITU-R BT.709-5 transfer function for
. You can manually set the transfer function using
and
to avoid this substitution.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
An error code that indicates the chroma siting information is absent.
An error code that indicates the image’s color space is missing.
An error code that indicates the required conversion matrix is absent.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that uses a higher-quality, slower resampling filter for geometry operations.
A flag that prevents vImage from allocating additional storage.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Initializes a vImage buffer with a copy of the contents of a Core Video pixel buffer.
A mutable description of image encoding in a Core Video pixel buffer.
Copies an RGB-to-YpCbCr conversion matrix to an image format’s internal matrix.
Sets the chrominance siting of a Core Video image format.
Sets the color space of a Core Video image format.
Creates an RGB color space based on primitives from Y’CbCr specifications.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The description of a Core Graphics image.
A description of the position of the pixel data in the image, relative to a reference XYZ color space.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
A key to the transfer function for high-definition and standard-definition video.
A key to the transfer function for HDTV interim video.
The standard Red Green Blue (sRGB) color space.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
